tool.name: Scatter Plot
tool.command:
scatterPlot.py --input $input --ID $uniqID #if $design and $group --design $design --group $group #end if
--xaxis $xaxis --yaxis $yaxis
#if "$title" --title "$title" #end if
#if $xname --xname $xname #end if #if $yname --yname $yname #end if
--fig $fig

param.name: input
param.label: Stacked Dataset
param.help: Input dataset in wide format and tab separated. If not tab separated see TIP below.

param.name: uniqID
param.label: Sample ID
param.help: Name of the column in your Wide Dataset that has unique compound/gene IDs.

param.name: design
param.label: Design File [Optional].
param.help: Design file tab separated. Note you need a 'sampleID' column. If not tab separated see TIP below

param.name: group
param.label: Group/Treatment [Optional]
param.help: Name of the column in your Design File that contains group classifications.

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark **TIP:** If your data is not TAB delimited, use *Text Manipulation->Convert*
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
**What it does**
Builds a 2d scatter plot.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
**Input**
**Required**
**Stacked Dataset:**
A stacked formatted dataset that contains measurements for each sample.::
+----------+-----+-----+-----+-----+ | sampleID | x1 | y1 | x2 | ... | +==========+=====+=====+=====+=====+ | sample1 | 10 | 20 | 10 | ... | | sample2 | 5 | 22 | 30 | ... | | sample3 | 30 | 27 | 2 | ... | | sample4 | 32 | 17 | 8 | ... | | ... | ... | ... | ... | ... | +----------+-----+-----+-----+-----+
**NOTE:** The sample IDs must match the sample IDs in the Design File (below). However the name of the columns do not matter because you put that in.
**Sample ID**
The column name in your stacked dataset that contains sample information.
**Column name with X-value**
The column name in your stacked dataset that contains the x-value you want to plot (i.e., x1 or PC1)
**Column name with Y-value**
The column name in your stacked dataset that contains the y-value you want to plot (i.e., y1 or PC2)
**Optional**
**Plot title**
Title to display on your plot.
**Design File:**
A design file relating samples to various groups/treatment if you want to color by group.::
+----------+--------+ | sampleID | group1 | +==========+========+ | sample1 | g1 | | sample2 | g1 | | sample3 | g1 | | sample4 | g2 | | sample5 | g2 | | sample6 | g2 | | ... | ... | +----------+--------+
**NOTE: You must have a column named *sampleID*** and the values in this column must match the columns names in the stack formatted dataset. Extra columns will be ignored.
**Group/Treatment**
- The column name in your design file that contains group information. In our example design file we would put *group1*.
**X-axis label**
- Label to put on the X-axis
**Y-axis label**
- Label to put on the Y-axis
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
**Output Files**
- This tool outputs a 2d scatter plot.
